image.altText: People wave Palestinian flags in support of resolution.

props.synopsis: Australian Foreign Minister Penny Wong suggests the federal government is contemplating recognising Palestinian statehood, saying international recognition could help "build momentum towards a two-state solution" with Israel.

title.children: Wong suggests Australian government considering recognising Palestinian statehood

image.altText: A woman wearing a black cap and a khaki vest smiles at the camera

props.synopsis: The IDF is still trying to explain exactly how aid workers, including Australian Zomi Frankcom, were fatally bombed by its forces in Gaza. But we could be about to find out whether Israel's military has learnt anything from its "grave mistake".

title.children: Why we're about to find out if the IDF learnt anything from its 'grave mistake'

image.altText: An older man with a scruffy, grey beard wearing a blue jumper stands on a beach.

props.synopsis: People have been giving fisherman Craig Garland lots of advice as he prepares to become a member of the Tasmanian parliament. Among the wisdom is: "Don't wear a suit, don't dress up … you're not one of them".

title.children: Meet Craig Garland, the self-proclaimed 'anti-politician' whose appointment has rocked the Tasmanian Liberals' boat

image.altText: MONA Ladie's Lounge and Kirsha Kaechele and supporters.

props.synopsis: MONA refusing to allow a man to enter its Ladies Lounge was discriminatory, a tribunal has found. The tribunal's deputy president has also called out the behaviour of a group of women for their "performance art" during the hearing in March.

title.children: Tasmania's MONA gallery ordered to permit men inside 'women-only' lounge

image.altText: A woman with a green shirt and glasses looks through a rack of clothing in a consignment store.

props.synopsis: The rate of retail businesses shutting up shop for good more than doubles in two years as consumers battle a higher cost of living. The sector's lobby group is urging the federal government to provide retailers with support when it hands down its budget next month.

title.children: 'They need help now': Retail insolvencies on the rise as customers face mounting cost-of-living pressures

image.altText: Sam Mostyn smiles while standing in a courtyard

props.synopsis: The history of our federation is groaningly replete with viceregal drama. What is rare, however, is for the announcement of a new governor-general designate to generate vicious denunciations on day one.

title.children: Incoming governor-general Sam Mostyn broke ground in generating such vicious denunciations so quickly

image.altText: A woman rest her head on a pillow, she looks to the side, with a neutral expression.

props.synopsis: People with chronic pain are suffering infections, shocks and even more pain from a device advertised as safe and effective. There are now calls for them to be recalled following a Four Corners investigation.

title.children: 'I'm so sorry': Teresa had a minor procedure to treat her chronic pain. The surgeon struck her spinal cord

image.altText: Signage on a store window reading "OPTUS YES"

props.synopsis: Protections introduced in the wake of the 2022 Optus data breach block more than 300,000 fraudulent attempts to use Australians' stolen data.

title.children: Australian register of stolen data blocks more than 300,000 attempts of identity fraud

image.altText: Two aerial photos of apartment buildings, one with greenery and the other with destroyed buildings and rubble

props.synopsis: Entire cities are transformed in the months since the October 7 Hamas attack and Israel's ensuing bombardment of the Gaza Strip. Drone footage shows the full extent of the damage.

title.children: Gaza's children once rode their bikes through these streets. After six months of war, only rubble remains

image.altText: Jacqui Lambie and Tammy Tyrrell and others.

props.synopsis: Ex-Jacqui Lambie Network member Tammy Tyrrell reveals she split from the party after being told by JLN board members she wasn't performing well enough — but who is on the board remains unclear.

title.children: Tyrrell reveals criticism from Lambie Network board members fuelled decision to resign

image.altText: An image of Brittany Higgins next to an image of Bruce Lehrmann.

props.synopsis: The Federal Court has published final submissions made by Brittany Higgins in Bruce Lehrmann's defamation case against Network Ten and journalist Lisa Wilkinson.

title.children: Brittany Higgins gave 'unwavering' account of alleged rape throughout defamation trial: lawyer

image.altText: A man in a pink shirt with a laptop looking unimpressed

props.synopsis: Andrew Ryder's rainy-day bank account was drained in just one day. It happened via phone porting and SIM-swap fraud, but the veteran has no idea how scammers had his data in the first place.

title.children: Man's digital identity trashed and bank account drained after fraudsters steal phone number

image.altText: Sun setting through a line of transmission towers

props.synopsis: In what it says is the biggest poll of Australians' attitudes towards the renewable energy transition, the CSIRO finds almost half of those surveyed feel the shift should be moderately paced, and most are unwilling to accept higher bills to pay for it.

title.children: CSIRO survey finds most Australians want moderately paced energy transition

image.altText: The University of Tasmania's lion logo on its city accommodation.

props.synopsis: The University of Tasmania says it will sell off two hotels it bought in central Hobart as it plans for a future with fewer international students.

title.children: UTAS to sell two Hobart hotels amid declining international student numbers

image.altText: A wide angle shot of Risdon Prison in Tasmania.

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian prisoner who committed a number of animal cruelty offences, including killing juvenile sparrows, while behind bars could potentially face more jail time.

title.children: Cruelty to birds could land Tasmanian inmate more jail time

image.altText: A man wearing a baseball cap gives his dog a treat. They are pictured in a park.

props.synopsis: At Victoria Police, Peter Romanis says he can see the impact of compassion fatigue all around him. And it's led him on a search for answers.

title.children: Years of responding to trauma left this police officer with 'compassion fatigue', now he's working to help others

image.altText: The Australian Competition and Consumer Commission (ACCC) logo in a boardroom at the regulator's office.

props.synopsis: Australia's competition watchdog, the ACCC, will be given far stronger powers to prevent companies making repeated under-the-radar acquisitions that could harm competition and consumers. The changes are the biggest reforms to merger settings in almost 50 years.

title.children: Competition watchdog to get a boost in powers that would make it easier to block mergers causing consumers harm

image.altText: A group of people holding Israeli flags.

props.synopsis: Israel's ultra-Orthodox community has always been exempt from mandatory military service but a ruling in the country's highest court has changed everything.

title.children: '200,000 Torah students' are allegedly protecting Israel. Critics say it's time they fought

image.altText: A sunny image of the grand front gate of Cranbrook private school

props.synopsis: A Cranbrook school teacher who has been on leave following Four Corners revelations has been temporarily banned from teaching in New South Wales schools.

title.children: Cranbrook teacher who allegedly sent graphic emails banned from teaching in NSW schools

image.altText: James and Jennifer Crumbley sit at a table in court wearing prison clothes, awaiting sentencing

props.synopsis: In a landmark ruling, James and Jennifer Crumbley are the first parents convicted over a US mass school shooting.

title.children: Parents of Michigan school shooter jailed for at least 10 years

image.altText: A man wearing round glasses and a blue shirt smiles warmly at someone off-camera

props.synopsis: Professor Peter Higgs, who is credited with one of the great scientific discoveries of modern times, dies peacefully at home aged 94.

title.children: Peter Higgs, the physicist who helped us understand the Big Bang, dies aged 94

image.altText: A male seller surrounded by customers wearing hijab.

props.synopsis: A playful "takjil war" has erupted in Indonesia after non-Muslims started buying up snacks and food usually eaten to break the fast during Ramadan.

title.children: There's a 'war' happening in Indonesia that you probably don't know about

image.altText: A composite image of three men, Eddie McGuire, Andrew Dillon and Barry Rigby.

props.synopsis: Independent MP Andrew Wilkie's allegations of rampant illicit drug use in the AFL have rocked the game. Now stakeholders past and present face a divide on what is best for the sport and the players themselves.

title.children: 'You should be named': McGuire wants AFL to toughen code's illicit drugs policy

image.altText: A hand with a blue glove reaches into a fridge containing bags of labelled donated breast milk.

props.synopsis: Red Cross Lifeblood has had to bring in breastmilk from interstate to supply Queensland hospitals where it is needed for premature babies and those born with a low weight.

title.children: Queensland babies relying on interstate breastmilk donations as local supply falls

image.altText: Smiling women front a media pack after their human rights court win

props.synopsis: Europe's human rights court has ruled two of three key climate change cases before it are inadmissible, but found in favour of another — a group of Swiss women who say their government's climate fight is "woefully inadequate".

title.children: Swiss women win in human rights court on climate argument, but two separate cases ruled 'inadmissible'

image.altText: A wide shot of the front entrance to Casuarina Prison, with two men dressed in blue walking out and trees in the foreground.

props.synopsis: A coronial inquest into WA's first recorded death in youth custody has heard it's not possible to treat detainees lawfully and humanely at Unit 18.WARNING: This story contains the name and image of an Indigenous person who has died.

title.children: Inquest into death of Cleveland Dodd hears humane treatment impossible at notorious Unit 18

image.altText: A graphic of a thermometer and the globe indicating rising heat

props.synopsis: As the world continues its spell of hottest months on record, leading climate scientists say there is a margin to the persistent heat which cannot be explained by the effects of known climate drivers and global warming.

title.children: 'Uncharted territory': The world's extreme heat can't be fully explained, and scientists are worried

image.altText: a boy toddler smiling into the camera

props.synopsis: Concerns were raised about the evidence against Aaron Harley James, including a problematic police interview of a minor.

title.children: Queensland man accused of killing toddler stepson declared innocent with charges dropped

image.altText: A man in a grey polo shirt stands in a green field under a blue sky.

props.synopsis: A western Victorian man is accused of altering the stone arrangement believed to be 1,500 years old, but he is disputing the site's history, suggesting it is not of Aboriginal origins.

title.children: Farmer charged with harming Aboriginal heritage after stones allegedly moved from giant eel arrangement

image.altText: People are splashing in a pool built on the foreshore.

props.synopsis: Tanya Plibersek has announced she plans to reject an apartment and retail development on an "internationally important" wetland at Queensland's Moreton Bay.

title.children: Controversial development on 'internationally important' wetland tentatively rejected

image.altText: Three navy ships in the water.

props.synopsis: Taipei says its military will simulate a scenario in which China suddenly turns one of its regular drills around the island into an actual attack.

title.children: Taiwan to practise responding to Chinese attacks during annual military exercises

image.altText: A transgender woman walks past photographs outside a court house.

props.synopsis: Social media platform Giggle for Girls is being sued by transgender woman Roxanne Tickle after her access to the women-only app was revoked. The app's owner has denied Ms Tickle is a woman.

title.children: Transgender woman sues women-only social media platform she was excluded from

image.altText: A sunset over solar panels and vineyards

props.synopsis: One of Australia's largest wineries, Casella Family Brands, has installed almost 9,000 solar panels — enough to power more than 1,900 homes.

title.children: Winery using more electricity than a small town turns to solar power as industry pushes to decarbonise

image.altText: A young John Farnham with long hair, smiling and wearing a leather jacket.

props.synopsis: Australian singing superstar John Farnham has announced the release of his memoir. After being asked many times, Farnham says "it finally felt like the right time to sit down and tell my story".

title.children: John Farnham to break his silence about personal life in new memoir
